urls.title: Flood management without concrete since 1220

urls.title: Chiswell Storm Defences ‚Äì Dorset Coast Forum
urls.description: The Storms and Coastal Defences at Chiswell booklet was produced for the residents of Chiswell about the coastal defences at Chiswell. The booklet was produced in April 2015 and explains how the coastal defences work and help to protect the community and what may happen in future. It is hoped that this booklet will also help the community to prepare for floods from any future storms. This booklet has been written with contributions from the Environment Agency, Weymouth and Portland Borough Council, CH2M

Thank you to everyone involved in getting these up quickly today and supporting residents in #Weybridge. 

If you need help go to https://t.co/5SAukuZYc0 or call 0345 988 1188 to speak to a floodline advisor (24/7) https://t.co/VuIJO9O0oo

Happy World Wetlands Day! After successful scrub management last winter by the #UST and #NorthDevonNIA projects, this #culmgrassland has regenerated and is a mosaic of scrub, grassland & wetland, helping store water. Thanks to @SouthWestWater, @Interreg2Seas, @DevonCC, @EnvAgency https://t.co/xb6FSZm0rT

You are 100% right, Dr Paul! I have met @EnvAgency frontline folk in a variety of capacities and they are dedicated underpaid people who work there to help make a difference. That their 'superiors' - a term I use in the loosest sense - behave like this for huge salaries is sick. https://t.co/N5LqxiMwjV

@emmahowardboyd @EnvAgency hopes that governments ‚Äúheed the recommendations‚Äù of the #dasguptareview ‚Äúgovernments and companies everywhere should take a good look at their globally supply chains‚Äù https://t.co/UWl2Qow8ga

We've been at @HardcastleNT today to have a nosy around after the turbulent few days we've been having weather wise. Check out the tethered leaky dams doing their job of keeping Hebden Bridge dry. We are incredibly pleased to see our work doing a grand job.
#slowtheflow https://t.co/WGLm6eQX6F

We've seen a lot of rain across the #Midlands in recent weeks. The ground is saturated and rivers full. Just a small amount of rainfall could see the risk of flooding increase again and flood warnings issued. Stay #FloodAware https://t.co/eAha3Se3q6

@stuartminnikin @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @DefraGovUK @DefraNature @BiodiversityEA @YorkDalesRT @Jack_Hirst3 @wildlifetoursuk @ilkleyIain @SandTCUKYorks @NeilBirkett1 Thanks Stu. Good Q. It's easier for trout to adopt hierarchy in rivers, large fish occupying & holding best feeding lies etc. Lochs without numerous bait fish, much more of a free for all. So more likely that excess production (if ever achieved) will simply redistribute 1/2

@suesustainable @RussellB1ggs @EnvAgency Both done and that is story in itself. Currently waiting on further details from subject access request. Funnily  enough the council have been stalling on giving me what I am legally entitled to receive. What are they hiding ü§î

The surprising life this story has taken on seems to have been a welcome distraction from current events. We only went out to paddle across the Meadows because @jeffpolton had been watching the @EnvAgency river gauges on the Dee and were there at the right time to help out. https://t.co/KB5rTLL8de

urls.title: Mousehole property protection - your flood resilience
urls.description: Find out more about the free property protection available to you as a homeowner in Mousehole. Hosted by the Environment Agency, these two virtual events include a presentation on the free property protection available and give you the opportunity to ask questions.

tweets.text: At public accounts com. on 14 Jan, EA chief @JamesBevanEA  said ‚Äúwe are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams.‚Äù Since then he has written to clarify. The EA does not permit companies to discharge untreated sewage into any chalk stream on a day-to-day basis,‚Äù

urls.title: EA boss backtracks on sewage pollution blunder
urls.description: Environment Agency chief executive Sir James Bevan has been forced to issue a clarification after he incorrectly told a House of Commons committee that the regulator did not allow water firms to discharge raw sewage into chalk streams.
